data.title: Meet Volkswagen ID.4 2024 - Electric SUV
data.meta_description: Visit our website to discover VW ID.4 2024 model - our new electric crossover SUV. With its iconic design and approachable cost, this EV is for everyone.
data.text:
Yes! The ID.4 currently qualifies for the federal iZEV rebateOpen external link of $5,000. Depending on the province in which you live, you may be eligible to receive additional incentives. These include, but are not limited to, up to $4,000* from British Columbia’s Go Electric BC ProgramOpen external link (available on the ID.4 base trim only) or as much as $7,000 from Quebec’s Roulez Vert programOpen external link.

Volkswagen Canada does not administer the incentives and is not responsible for any cancellations or changes to the incentive programs. Incentive information is provided for informational purposes only and Volkswagen Canada makes no representations or warranties about the actual amounts or eligibility. Information about the incentives is based on the most current information provided by the applicable government agencies, but could change in the future. The amount of the incentive, terms and conditions of the incentive, and any eligibility or application requirements vary by province. *BC’s rebate is only available on the ID.4 Base trim and is prorated based on annual income and only available to those earning <$100,000 with the full amount available to those earning <$80,000. BC’s EV charger rebate has different eligibility criteria. Conditions apply. See your dealer for more details or contact the provincial or federal administrator.

You can charge the ID.4 on the road using any Electrify Canada DC fast charging station. Or if you’re looking for a level 2 home charger, we recommend the Volkswagen 2-in-1 Charging Cable. It’s fast, smart and streamlined to give you the ease and convenience you deserve at home.

You may be eligible for a rebate if you live in Quebec or British Columbia:

In Quebec, the Roulez Vert program offers an additional rebate of $600 with the purchase of the Volkswagen 2-in-1 Charging Cable.◊◊

If you live in BC in a single-family home, row home or duplex, you could receive a rebate of up to 50% of the purchase and installation costs of an eligible Level 2 EV charger, to a maximum of $350.◊◊

*Charging times will vary and depend on a variety of factors, including ambient temperature, charger type, battery condition and initial state of charge, vehicle condition and others.

◊◊ Volkswagen Canada does not administer the incentives and is not responsible for any cancellations or changes to the incentive programs. Incentive information is provided for informational purposes only and Volkswagen Canada makes no representations or warranties about the actual amounts or eligibility. Information about the incentives is based on the most current information provided by the applicable government agencies, but could change in the future. The amount of the incentive, terms and conditions of the incentive, and any eligibility or application requirements vary by province. *BC’s EV incentive amount is prorated based on annual income and only available to those earning <$100,000 with the full amount available to those earning <$80,000. BC’s EV charger rebate has different eligibility criteria. Conditions apply. See your dealer for more details or contact the provincial or federal administrator.

With a DC fast charger, you can charge 10% to 80% in an estimated 30 minutes. That means a 10-minute charge can add almost 100 km of range.*

When paired with a Level 2 AC residential home charger, the ID.4 can be charged from near-empty to full in as little as 6 hours*. Charging with a 9.6 kW AC station will take approximately 9 hours, while a 7.2 kW AC station will take approximately 11.5 hours.*

* Estimated charging times are provided as a reference only. Actual charging times will vary based on battery state of charge, driving behaviour, battery condition, current, resistance, and ambient temperature, available voltage and charging frequency. Frequent and consecutive fast charging can permanently decrease battery capacity.
